Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2012 02:39PM carlads wrote: Timbuktu, I am with you!  I had a core needle biopsy came back IDC 2cm cell grade 2.  When I went to see my ocologist before surgery he had more of my pathology report.  He said I was Triple negative which is harder to treat, but does respond well to Chemo.  I was going to have 3 different drugs and dose dense (every two weeks instead of every 21 days) I was ok with that and did all my research on it.  Before my surgery I was injected with the nuclear dye to map out the sentinel node they tested it and it came back 1mm micro. So my surgeon did do a Axillary node dissection.  He took 22 nodes and they were all negative. When I went in after surgery to see my Oncologist he told me the pathology report had good news, turns out I do have some hormone recepts so I am not a true TN.  My entire treatment plan changed.   Now only 4 cycles of Chemo and only Taxotere and Cytoxan.  I have a Chemo class on Wedneday so I plan on asking a lot of questions..  Still kinda sore from surgery two weeks ago but not too bad.
